jonbyrne1254 wrote:

> I took out the exception handling and that did it, but I think this
> might not be the best way to go about it. I`m going to go and do a
> bit of redesign. Thanks for the help anyway, its much appreciated.

Where did you take out the exception handling? If it's just in the test 
wrapper, then don't worry: your exception handling was likely 
duplicating JUnit's effort, anyway. An alternatve is to catch the 
exception, then fail() with an appropriately detailed failure message. 
Ordinarily that's not worth the effort, as JUnit reports the failures 
(as errors) just fine.

Best of luck.
--
